definition: ghost of one who died unjustly/departed spirit demanding vengeance for grievances
soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body
Black Register of Lost Souls, long novel by Peng Yangou 彭養鷗|彭养鸥 about the destructive influence of opium, published in 1897 and 1909

sentences.english: Look , I am very haleness! You are a enmity fetch among innumerability. Foolish and clumsiness are your epitaph.
sentences.chinese: 你是无数冤魂中的一个，愚蠢和笨拙是你的墓志铭。

sentences.english: The first chapter is about the creation time and the spread situation of"Accounts of Avenging Spirits".
sentences.chinese: 第一章，介绍《冤魂志》的成书及流传情况。

sentences.english: The second chapter is to describe the ideological inclination of"Accounts of Avenging Spirits".
sentences.chinese: 第二章，评述《冤魂志》的思想倾向。

sentences.english: The third chapter is the narrative analysis of"Accounts of Avenging Spirits".
sentences.chinese: 第三章，《冤魂志》的叙事分析。

sentences.english: Some said that fish was the ghost of a thief who'd drowned in that river 60 years before.
sentences.chinese: 有人说这条鱼是60年前淹死在河中的小偷冤魂化身。
